description.zh-cn: 明末清初的政治人物和军事将领。原为明朝崇祯年间的兵部尚书、蓟辽总督，在松锦之战中兵败被俘后投降清朝，成为清朝首位汉人大学士，对清朝巩固统治贡献甚多。
description.en: A political and military figure of the late Ming and early Qing dynasties. Originally the Minister of War and Viceroy of Jiliao during the Chongzhen era of the Ming dynasty, he surrendered to the Qing dynasty after being defeated and captured in the Battle of Songjin. He became the first Han Chinese Grand Secretary of the Qing dynasty and contributed significantly to the consolidation of Qing rule.

description.zh-cn: 明朝的最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 清朝的开国皇帝。
description.en: The founding emperor of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明清战争期间的一场决定性战役，以清军的胜利和明军主帅洪承畴的被俘告终。
description.en: A decisive battle during the Ming-Qing transition, which ended with a Qing victory and the capture of the Ming commander, Hong Chengchou.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上最后一个封建王朝。
description.en: The last imperial dynasty in Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 中国历史上由汉族建立的最后一个大一统王朝。
description.en: The last great unified dynasty in Chinese history established by the Han people.

description.zh-cn: 明末官员，时任兵部尚书，因催促洪承畴出战，被认为是导致松锦之战失败的原因之一。
description.en: A late Ming official, then Minister of War, who is considered one of the reasons for the defeat in the Battle of Songjin due to his urging of Hong Chengchou to attack.

description.zh-cn: 明末官员，被兵部尚书陈新甲派去监督和催促洪承畴进军。
description.en: A late Ming official sent by Minister of War Chen Xinjia to supervise and urge Hong Chengchou to advance.

description.zh-cn: 明末官员，被兵部尚书陈新甲派去监督和催促洪承畴进军。
description.en: A late Ming official sent by Minister of War Chen Xinjia to supervise and urge Hong Chengchou to advance.

description.zh-cn: 皇太极的妃子，顺治帝的生母，康熙帝的祖母。据传在劝降洪承畴的过程中起了重要作用。
description.en: A consort of Hong Taiji, the mother of the Shunzhi Emperor, and the grandmother of the Kangxi Emperor. She is said to have played an important role in persuading Hong Chengchou to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 清朝初年重臣，受皇太极派遣成功劝降洪承畴。
description.en: An important minister in the early Qing dynasty who was dispatched by Hong Taiji and successfully persuaded Hong Chengchou to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 清朝初年杰出的政治家和军事家，清军入关的实际决策者。
description.en: An outstanding politician and military strategist in the early Qing dynasty, the de facto decision-maker for the Qing conquest of China.

description.zh-cn: 明末农民起义军领袖，大顺政权的建立者。
description.en: Leader of a peasant rebellion in the late Ming dynasty and founder of the Shun dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明朝灭亡后，由明朝宗室在南方建立的抵抗清朝的政权。
description.en: Regimes established by remnants of the Ming imperial family in southern China after the fall of the Ming dynasty, resisting the Qing.

description.zh-cn: 南明最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Southern Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 明末官员，兵败被俘后拒绝洪承畴的劝降，并当面斥责他，后被杀害。
description.en: A late Ming official who, after being defeated and captured, refused to surrender when persuaded by Hong Chengchou, rebuked him to his face, and was later executed.

description.zh-cn: 明末抗清人士，被俘后以洪承畴“殉国”之事反讽羞辱洪承畴，后被杀害。
description.en: A late Ming anti-Qing figure who, after being captured, sarcastically shamed Hong Chengchou by referring to his supposed 'martyrdom', and was later executed.

description.zh-cn: 明末官员，被清廷扣留后拒绝洪承畴的说降，称其为“鬼”。
description.en: A late Ming official who, after being detained by the Qing court, refused Hong Chengchou's persuasion to surrender, calling him a 'ghost'.

description.zh-cn: 明末学者、官员，被俘后作对联讽刺洪承畴，后被杀害。
description.en: A late Ming scholar and official who, after being captured, wrote a couplet satirizing Hong Chengchou and was later executed.

description.zh-cn: 明末诗人、抗清志士，年仅十七岁被捕，当庭斥责洪承畴，后被杀害。
description.en: A late Ming poet and anti-Qing patriot who was arrested at the age of seventeen, denounced Hong Chengchou in court, and was later executed.

description.zh-cn: 明朝兴国公，拒绝薙发归顺，临死前大骂洪承畴。
description.en: Duke Xingguo of the Ming dynasty, who refused to adopt the queue hairstyle and surrender, and cursed Hong Chengchou before his death.

description.zh-cn: 明朝高级军事职务，负责蓟州、辽东等地的防务。
description.en: A high-ranking military position in the Ming dynasty, responsible for the defense of Jizhou, Liaodong, and other areas.

description.zh-cn: 中国古代官职，为六部中兵部的最高长官。
description.en: An official title in ancient China, the head of the Ministry of War, one of the Six Ministries.

description.zh-cn: 明清时期的内阁高级官员，为事实上的宰相。
description.en: A high-ranking official of the Grand Secretariat during the Ming and Qing dynasties, serving as a de facto chancellor.

en: Biographies of Twice-Serving Ministers of the Ming Period

description.zh-cn: 清朝乾隆年间由国史馆编纂的史书，记录了明末降清官员的传记，洪承畴被列为甲篇之首。
description.en: A historical book compiled by the State Historiographer's Office during the Qianlong era of the Qing dynasty, recording the biographies of Ming officials who surrendered to the Qing. Hong Chengchou was listed at the top of Volume A.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴的父亲。
description.en: Hong Chengchou's father.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴的母亲。
description.en: Hong Chengchou's mother.

position.zh-cn: 总督蓟辽军务兵部尚书
position.en: Viceroy of Jiliao and Minister of War

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴在明朝官至兵部尚书、蓟辽总督，在松锦之战中兵败被俘前一直为明朝服务。
description.en: Hong Chengchou served the Ming dynasty as Minister of War and Viceroy of Jiliao until his defeat and capture in the Battle of Songjin.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴是崇祯帝手下的重臣，负责镇压农民起义和防御清军。
description.en: Hong Chengchou was a key minister under the Chongzhen Emperor, responsible for suppressing peasant rebellions and defending against the Qing army.

description.zh-cn: 在松锦之战中，洪承畴率领的明军惨败，其本人被清军俘虏，导致其明朝生涯的终结。
description.en: In the Battle of Songjin, the Ming army led by Hong Chengchou was decisively defeated, and he himself was captured by the Qing army, ending his career in the Ming dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 皇太极亲自率领清军主力驰援锦州，并制定了包围和切断明军粮道的战略，最终赢得了松锦之战的胜利。
description.en: Hong Taiji personally led the main Qing forces to reinforce Jinzhou and devised the strategy of encircling and cutting off the Ming army's supply lines, ultimately winning the Battle of Songjin.

description.zh-cn: 时任兵部尚书的陈新甲派遣张若麒等人催促洪承畴速战速决，打乱了洪承畴原定的持久战方略，是导致松锦之战失败的原因之一。
description.en: Chen Xinjia, the Minister of War, dispatched Zhang Ruoqi and others to urge Hong Chengchou for a quick battle, disrupting Hong's original strategy of protracted warfare and contributing to the defeat at the Battle of Songjin.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴被俘后，皇太极费尽心思进行劝降，并亲自以脱下自己的貂皮大衣为他披上的方式感动了他，最终使其归降。
description.en: After Hong Chengchou was captured, Hong Taiji went to great lengths to persuade him to surrender, personally moving him by taking off his own sable coat and putting it on him, which ultimately led to his surrender.

description.zh-cn: 相传孝庄文皇后（庄妃）曾亲自探望被囚的洪承畴并劝降，在他的投降过程中起了作用。
description.en: It is said that Empress Xiaozhuangwen (Consort Zhuang) personally visited the imprisoned Hong Chengchou and persuaded him to surrender, playing a role in his defection.

description.zh-cn: 范文程受皇太极派遣劝降洪承畴，通过观察洪承畴爱惜衣物的细节，判断其并无死志，从而成功说服皇太极继续招降。
description.en: Fan Wencheng was sent by Hong Taiji to persuade Hong Chengchou. By observing the detail that Hong cherished his clothes, Fan judged that Hong had no intention of dying and thus successfully persuaded Hong Taiji to continue the effort to recruit him.

position.zh-cn: 大学士、太傅、太子太师、经略五省总督军务
position.en: Grand Secretary, Grand Tutor, Grand Preceptor of the Crown Prince, Viceroy for Military Affairs over Five Provinces

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴于1642年降清，成为清朝首位汉人大学士，并担任多个要职，直至去世。
description.en: Hong Chengchou surrendered to the Qing in 1642, becoming the first Han Chinese Grand Secretary and holding various important posts until his death.

description.zh-cn: 清兵入关后，洪承畴向多尔衮献计，建议清军主力先进攻李自成的大顺军，该计策被采纳。
description.en: After the Qing army entered the Shanhai Pass, Hong Chengchou advised Dorgon to first attack Li Zicheng's Shun army, a strategy that was adopted.

description.zh-cn: 崇祯十一年，洪承畴在潼关南原大战中大破李自成军，使其仅剩十八骑兵败走商洛，是明末农民起义的低潮。
description.en: In 1638, Hong Chengchou decisively defeated Li Zicheng's army at the Battle of Tongguan Nanyuan, forcing Li to flee to Shangluo with only eighteen cavalrymen, marking a low point for the late Ming peasant rebellions.

position.zh-cn: 经略湖广、广东、广西、云南、贵州五省总督军务
position.en: Viceroy for Military Affairs over Huguang, Guangdong, Guangxi, Yunnan, and Guizhou

description.zh-cn: 顺治十年起，洪承畴被任命为五省经略，负责征讨南明永历政权，最终平定云贵地区。
description.en: Starting in 1653, Hong Chengchou was appointed Viceroy over five provinces, responsible for the campaign against the Southern Ming's Yongli regime, ultimately pacifying the Yunnan-Guizhou region.

description.zh-cn: 洪承畴率领清军征讨南明，最终迫使永历帝（桂王）流亡缅甸。
description.en: Hong Chengchou led the Qing army's campaign against the Southern Ming, ultimately forcing the Yongli Emperor (Prince of Gui) to flee to Burma.

description.zh-cn: 乾隆年间编纂的《明季贰臣传》将洪承畴列为“贰臣”甲篇之首，对其降清行为给予了官方的负面评价。
description.en: The 'Biographies of Twice-Serving Ministers of the Ming Period', compiled during the Qianlong era, listed Hong Chengchou at the top of Volume A of 'Twice-Serving Ministers', giving an official negative assessment of his surrender to the Qing.

description.zh-cn: 金声被俘后，当面斥责洪承畴冒充已为明朝殉国的忠臣，拒绝其劝降。
description.en: After being captured, Jin Sheng rebuked Hong Chengchou to his face, accusing him of impersonating a loyal minister who had died for the Ming, and rejected his persuasion to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 在劝降金声失败后，洪承畴下令将其斩首。
description.en: After failing to persuade Jin Sheng to surrender, Hong Chengchou ordered his execution.

description.zh-cn: 孙兆奎被俘后，在与洪承畴对话时，以“松山殉难的督师洪公”反讽洪承畴，使其难堪。
description.en: After being captured, Sun Zhaokui sarcastically referred to Hong Chengchou as 'Viceroy Hong who died a martyr at Songshan', shaming him.

description.zh-cn: 在被孙兆奎羞辱后，洪承畴下令将其斩杀。
description.en: After being shamed by Sun Zhaokui, Hong Chengchou ordered his execution.

description.zh-cn: 左懋第被清廷扣留后，洪承畴前来说降，左懋第称其为“鬼”，坚称真正的洪督师已在松山死节。
description.en: When Hong Chengchou came to persuade the detained Zuo Maodi to surrender, Zuo called him a 'ghost', insisting that the real Viceroy Hong had died a martyr at Songshan.

description.zh-cn: 黄道周被俘后，为洪承畴写下对联“史笔流芳，虽未成名终可法；洪恩浩荡，不思报国反成仇”，以史可法对比，讽刺洪承畴变节。
description.en: After being captured, Huang Daozhou wrote a couplet for Hong Chengchou that contrasted him with Shi Kefa, satirizing his betrayal: 'History's brush leaves a fragrant name, though not yet famous, one can eventually be a model (Kefa); Vast is the great favor (Hong'en), yet you don't think of repaying the country, instead becoming a foe (Chengchou).'

description.zh-cn: 年仅十七岁的夏完淳被捕后，在审讯时当庭怒斥洪承畴，称其冒名顶替为国捐躯的洪亨九，拒绝归顺。
description.en: After being arrested at the age of seventeen, Xia Wanchun denounced Hong Chengchou in court during his interrogation, claiming he was an impostor of the hero Hong Hengjiu who had died for the country, and refused to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 在保全夏完淳失败后，洪承畴下令将其斩杀。
description.en: After failing to save Xia Wanchun, Hong Chengchou ordered his execution.

description.zh-cn: 明朝兴国公王之仁在拒绝归顺后，临死前大骂洪承畴，称先帝祭奠他如同祭狗。
description.en: After refusing to surrender, Wang Zhiren, Duke Xingguo of Ming, cursed Hong Chengchou before his execution, saying that the late emperor's mourning for him was like mourning for a dog.

description.zh-cn: 在王之仁拒绝薙发归顺后，洪承畴决定将其处斩。
description.en: After Wang Zhiren refused to adopt the queue hairstyle and surrender, Hong Chengchou decided to have him executed.

description.zh-cn: 洪启熙是洪承畴的父亲。
description.en: Hong Qixi is the father of Hong Chengchou.

description.zh-cn: 傅氏是洪承畴的母亲。
description.en: Lady Fu is the mother of Hong Chengchou.
